TITLE: Initializing Stripe with loadStripe
DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to import and use the `loadStripe` function from `@stripe/stripe-js` to initialize Stripe.  It returns a Promise that resolves with a `Stripe` object. Replace the placeholder API key with your actual publishable key.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stripe/stripe-js/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: js
CODE:
```
import {loadStripe} from '@stripe/stripe-js';

const stripe = await loadStripe('pk_test_TYooMQauvdEDq54NiTphI7jx');
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Import Stripe.js as a side effect
DESCRIPTION: This imports `@stripe/stripe-js` as a side effect to ensure the Stripe.js script tag is inserted immediately upon page load throughout your site. This is important for Stripe's advanced fraud detection functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stripe/stripe-js/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: js
CODE:
```
import '@stripe/stripe-js';
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing loadStripe without side effects (CommonJS)
DESCRIPTION: This example imports `loadStripe` from `@stripe/stripe-js/pure`, deferring loading of the Stripe.js script until `loadStripe` is explicitly called. Useful if you don't want the script to load on every page.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stripe/stripe-js/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: js
CODE:
```
// CommonJS module import
const {loadStripe} = require('@stripe/stripe-js/pure');
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing loadStripe without side effects (ES Module)
DESCRIPTION: This example imports `loadStripe` from `@stripe/stripe-js/pure`, deferring loading of the Stripe.js script until `loadStripe` is explicitly called. Useful if you don't want the script to load on every page.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stripe/stripe-js/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: js
CODE:
```
// ES module import
import {loadStripe} from '@stripe/stripe-js/pure';

// Stripe.js will not be loaded until `loadStripe` is called
const stripe = await loadStripe('pk_test_TYooMQauvdEDq54NiTphI7jx');
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Stripe.js module
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the `@stripe/stripe-js` module using npm. This allows you to import Stripe.js as a CommonJS or ES module in your JavaScript project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stripe/stripe-js/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npm install @stripe/stripe-js
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Manually including Stripe.js script tag
DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to manually include the Stripe.js script tag in the `<head>` of your site.  If the script tag is already present, the module will not insert a new one. When you call `loadStripe`, it will use the existing script tag.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stripe/stripe-js/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: html
CODE:
```
<!-- Somewhere in your site's <head> -->
<script src="https://js.stripe.com/basil/stripe.js" async></script>
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Disabling Advanced Fraud Detection
DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to disable advanced fraud detection by using `loadStripe.setLoadParameters` with the `advancedFraudSignals` option set to `false`. This function is only available when importing `loadStripe` from `@stripe/stripe-js/pure`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stripe/stripe-js/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: js
CODE:
```
// CommonJS module import
const {loadStripe} = require('@stripe/stripe-js/pure');
// ES module import
import {loadStripe} from '@stripe/stripe-js/pure';

loadStripe.setLoadParameters({advancedFraudSignals: false});
const stripe = await loadStripe('pk_test_TYooMQauvdEDq54NiTphI7jx');
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies with Yarn
DESCRIPTION: This command is used to install the necessary dependencies for the Stripe.js project. It relies on Yarn as the package manager.  Running this command ensures that all required libraries and tools are available for development and testing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/stripe/stripe-js/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
yarn install
```
